value.title: Change Excel Source in Power BI to OneDrive for Business   No Gateway Needed

Here in this video, I’ll explain an easy way to do that change.  Step by step guide is also explained here in

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
value.excerpt: It happens often in Power BI calculations and reports that you need to concatenate a list of values from a column. You can do this concatenation in Power Query or DAX. However, if the concatenation needs to be done dynamically. ConcatenateX is a very helpful DAX function to achieve such results. It is

value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. value.title: Drill Down and Up in Power BI Explained

value.title: Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI with NOT IN or NOT EQUAL Rule
value.excerpt: Sometimes when you apply the dynamic row-level security, you want to have the criteria as NOT EQUAL and NOT IN. value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Date dimension or calendar table is one of the most important dimensions in any BI system. In this video, I'm showing you how easy is to create a date dimension using Power Query. value.title: How to Reduce the Size of Power BI file in a few Steps
value.excerpt: One of the performance considerations of a Power BI file is to reduce the size of it as much as possible. Not having a Power BI account can happen because of many scenarios; your company might close this option so that the process be only channeled through a specific process

value.title: Removing the Total Value for a Column in the Table Visual of Power BI Using ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: Table visual is one of the most commonly used visuals. In Power BI, you can turn off the total row (when it won’t make sense to have the total) entirely. However, you cannot turn off the total for some columns and keep it working for the others. Using a DAX function, you can, however, do this easily.
